intro: Enckea swartzii, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a spike or panicle. Enckea swartzii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological dynamics in its native habitat.
